mn133:2.5: The incongruity in these questions is evidently a flaw in the Pali tradition, see Analayo’s The Verses on an Auspicious Night, Explained by Mahākaccāna—A Study and Translation of the Chinese Version, Canadian Journal of Buddhist Studies, Number Four, 2007
mn133:13.2: As in [mn18:16.1](), Kaccāna’s favored mode of analysis is through the six senses.
